verses.roman:
śrī-bhagavan uvāca
āyāsye bhavato geham
aham arya-samanvitaḥ
yadu-cakra-druhaṁ hatvā
vitariṣye suhṛt-priyam

synonyms: śrī-bhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Lord said; āyāsye—will come; bhavataḥ—to your; geham—house; aham—I; ārya—by My elder (brother, Balarāma); samanvitaḥ—accompanied; yadu-cakra—of the circle of Yadus; druham—the enemy (Kaṁsa); hatvā—killing; vitariṣye—I will grant; suhṛt—to My well-wishers; priyam—satisfaction.
translation: The Supreme Lord said: I will come to Your house with My elder brother, but first I must satisfy My friends and well-wishers by killing the enemy of the Yadu clan.

purport.content: Akrūra glorified Kṛṣṇa in Text 16 as yadūttama, "the best of the Yadus." Śrī Kṛṣṇa here confirms this by saying, in effect, "Since I am the best of the Yadus, I must kill the enemy of the Yadus, Kaṁsa, and then I will come to your house."
